title: Routledge Companion to Latina
creator: Cepeda, Maria Elena.$$QCepeda, Maria Elena.
contents: Cover; Title; Copyright; Dedication; Contents; List of Figures and Tables; Acknowledgments; List of Contributors; Part I Understanding Contemporary Latina/o Media; Introduction; 1 Authenticity, Appropriation, Articulation: The Cultural Logic of Latinidad; 2 The Transnational Restructuring of Communication and Consumption Practices: Latinos in the Urban Settings of Global Cities; 3 An Economic Historical Analysis of the Evolution of Latino Media in the New Latino South; 4 Implicit Utopias and Ambiguous Ethnics: Latinidad and the Representational Promised Land.

5 Phenotypicality Bias on Television? A Quantitative Content Analysis of Primetime TV6 Beyond the Market: Lessons Learned From Latina/o Families; Part II Access, Policy, and Production in Latina/o Media; Introduction; 7 Altering the U.S. Soundscape through Latina/o Community Radio; 8 The State of Emergency Communications at a Time of Population and Linguistic Shifts: A Case Study in Central Texas; 9 Direct to DVD: A Case Study of Latina/o Genre and Audience; 10 From the Bronze Screen to the Computer Screen: Latina/o Web Series and Independent Production.

11 Latina/o Community Journalism: A San Francisco Case Study12 The Cycle of Latina/o Community Media Activism: Digital Storytelling in Springfield, Massachusetts; Part III Representations of Latinas/os in the Media; Introduction; 13 Imagining Postville: National Public Radio and the Discourse of Latina/o Representation; 14 What's in an Accent? Gender and Cultural Stereotypes in the Work of Sofía Vergara; 15 The Cultural Location/s of (U.S.) Latin Rock; 16 Singing about Separation: Deportation, #Not1More, and La Santa Cecilia's "ICE: El Hielo."

17 The Deterritorialized Political Economy of Narcocorridos in the United States18 What to Do With All This Beauty? The Political Economy of Latina Stardom in the Twenty-First Century; 19 "Sofía Vergara Made Me Do It": On Beauty, Costeñismo, and Transnational Colombian Identity; 20 Sex, Service, and Scenery: Latina Sexualities in the Pages of Vogue; Part IV Engendering New Practices and Meanings Behind Latina/o Media Consumption; Introduction; 21 Voices From the Borderlands: Young Latina/os Discuss the Impact That Culture and Identity Have on Their Media Consumption.

22 Latina/os' Facebook Usage: An Inter-Ethnic and Inter- Generational Exploration of Their Engagement With a Social Networking Site23 An Indecent Proposal: Latino Masculinity and the Audience in Latina/o Music Video; 24 Crossover Fail: "Nigga"/Flex's "Romantic Style in Da World"; 25 Spreadable Citizenship: Undocumented Youth Activists and Social Media; Index.
